intro: Rhadinothamnus rudis subsp. rudis, commonly known as the slender thamnus, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in heathlands and open woodlands. It is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal and inland regions. The subspecies rudis is distinguished by its smaller size and more compact growth habit compared to other subspecies.
